data.title: Show Me The Election Results!
data.solution:
from collections import Counter
from decimal import Decimal, ROUND_HALF_UP

n = int(input())
votes = Counter()
for _ in range(n):
    votes[input()] += 1

length = max(len(name) for name in votes)
for name, frq in sorted(votes.items()):
    bars = Decimal.from_float(frq * 20 / n).to_integral(rounding=ROUND_HALF_UP)
    print(f'{name.rjust(length)}{" " * bool(bars)}{"@" * int(bars)}')
data.statement:
The votes of the recent CodinGame President have just been released, and everyone's eager to find out who won. The only problem is, it's your job to tally up the votes! Since there are a lot of votes to process, you decide to write a program to display the results as a simple bar chart for the rest of the CodinGame community to view easily.

For maximum data visualisation, here are some rules to help you in formatting your bar chart:

- For each of the [[K]] candidates who participated in the election, the bar chart should display the <<name of the candidate>> on the left and the bar representing the <<percentage of votes>> garnered on the right, separated by a single space.
- Candidate names should be <<sorted in ascending order and right-aligned>> (padded with spaces where necessary), while the percentage bars should be left-aligned.
- For simplicity, <<every>> {{@}} <<character shall represent {{5%}} of all votes garnered>>; vote percentages for each candidate should be rounded to the nearest multiple of 5. Prefer rounding up in the case where the percentage is exactly between two multiples of 5 (e.g., round {{32.5%}} to {{35%}}).

An example of the expected bar chart format is as follows:
```
   Emily @@@@@@@@@
Margaret @@@@@
   Simon @@@@@@```

data.constraints:
1 ≤ [[K]] ≤ 10
10 ≤ [[N]] ≤ 150
The names of all [[K]] candidates contain English letters only.
Each of the [[K]] candidates will receive at least 1 vote.

write who won?
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1>>: A positive integer [[N]] representing the total number of votes cast.
<<Next [[N]] lines>>: A single capitalised string representing the name of the candidate who has been voted for.
data.outputDescription: <<[[K]] lines>>: Formatted bar chart line with the candidate name on the left and the bar representing the percentage of votes garnered on the right. The bar chart line <<should not contain any trailing spaces>>.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

The votes of the recent CodinGame President have just been released, and everyone's eager to find out who won. The only problem is, it's your job to tally up the votes! Since there are a lot of votes to process, you decide to write a program to display the results as a simple bar chart for the rest of the CodinGame community to view easily.

For maximum data visualisation, here are some rules to help you in formatting your bar chart:

- For each of the K candidates who participated in the election, the bar chart should display the name of the candidate on the left and the bar representing the percentage of votes garnered on the right, separated by a single space.
- Candidate names should be sorted in ascending order and right-aligned (padded with spaces where necessary), while the percentage bars should be left-aligned.
- For simplicity, every @ character shall represent 5% of all votes garnered; vote percentages for each candidate should be rounded to the nearest multiple of 5. Prefer rounding up in the case where the percentage is exactly between two multiples of 5 (e.g., round 32.5% to 35%).

An example of the expected bar chart format is as follows:

   Emily @@@@@@@@@
Margaret @@@@@
   Simon @@@@@@





   

      
Input

      
Line 1: A positive integer N representing the total number of votes cast.
Next N lines: A single capitalised string representing the name of the candidate who has been voted for.

   

   

      
Output

      
K lines: Formatted bar chart line with the candidate name on the left and the bar representing the percentage of votes garnered on the right. The bar chart line should not contain any trailing spaces.

   

   

      
Constraints

      
1 ≤ K ≤ 10
10 ≤ N ≤ 150
The names of all K candidates contain English letters only.
Each of the K candidates will receive at least 1 vote.

   

   

      
Example

      

         

            
Input

            
10
John
John
Sara
John
Mary
Sara
Mary
John
Sara
Mary

         

         

            
Output

            
John @@@@@@@@
Mary @@@@@@
Sara @@@@@@
